Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the IoT solution, including the number of devices, expected data throughput, and integration with other Azure services.
Design the architecture for the IoT solution, including device connectivity, data ingestion, processing, and storage. Identify the Azure services to be used alongside IoT Hub.
Provision a new Azure IoT Hub in the Azure portal or using CLI/PowerShell. Select the appropriate pricing tier based on the project requirements.
Set up IoT Hub configurations, including message routing, endpoints, and device twins. Configure quotas and scaling as needed.
Enable security features such as per-device authentication, Azure Defender for IoT, and encryption for data in transit and at rest.
Register devices in the IoT Hub using the Device Provisioning Service (DPS) or manually through the Azure portal. Assign unique device IDs and credentials.
Develop the code for IoT devices to connect to the IoT Hub. Use SDKs provided by Azure for secure communication and data transmission.
Test the connectivity of IoT devices to the IoT Hub. Verify that devices can send and receive messages securely.
Configure monitoring and alerts for IoT Hub using Azure Monitor. Set up alerts for device connectivity issues, message delivery failures, and other critical metrics.
Integrate IoT Hub with other Azure services such as Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Functions, or Azure Data Lake for data processing and storage.
Document the IoT solution architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Include details on device registration, security measures, and monitoring setup.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the IoT Hub and connected devices.
Conduct regular security audits to ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory standards. Review device authentication, data encryption, and access controls.
Continuously monitor the performance of the IoT Hub, including message throughput, latency, and device connectivity. Address any performance issues promptly.
Periodically update the firmware of connected IoT devices to ensure compatibility with IoT Hub and address security vulnerabilities.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track IoT Hub metrics such as message delivery rates, device connectivity, and error rates. Investigate anomalies and ensure optimal performance.
Regularly audit IoT Hub security settings, including Shared Access Policies and device authentication methods. Ensure compliance with organizational security standards.
Rotate IoT Hub access keys periodically to enhance security and prevent unauthorized access.
Regularly back up IoT Hub configurations, including device identities, routing rules, and message settings, to ensure recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
Conduct failover tests to verify the resiliency of IoT Hub in case of regional outages or service disruptions.
Review and optimize message routing rules to ensure efficient data flow and processing within IoT Hub.
Validate the integrity and accuracy of telemetry data received from devices. Investigate discrepancies and resolve issues.

Tasks.Task: Review IoT Hub Quotas and Scaling
Tasks.Task Description: Monitor IoT Hub quotas and ensure the service is scaled appropriately to handle current and projected workloads.
Keep IoT Hub operational and configuration documentation up-to-date, including troubleshooting guides and best practices.
Simulate security incidents or service outages to ensure the team is prepared to respond effectively.
Analyze IoT Hub usage and optimize configurations to reduce costs while maintaining performance and reliability.
Ensure IoT Hub configurations and operations comply with relevant industry standards and regulations.
